newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest bourse rises to new highs.
newsitem.headline: Budapest bourse rises to new highs.

text.p: The Budapest Stock Exchange continued its bull run on Wednesday, benefiting from fresh capital flows and from a strong dollar, a trader said.
The BUX index, which set the fifth successive closing high on Tuesday, opened above the previous record of 7,742.25 points and surged to a new peak of 7,809.49 points.
At 1009 GMT the BUX index traded at 7,806.91 points, up 93.19 points.
"Fresh money keeps on flowing into the market," said Robert Forgo of MKB Securities. "Many of the leading stocks jumped substantially higher."
Early gainers included the chemicals stocks BorsodChem and TVK, oil firm MOL, tile maker Zalakeramia, and the pharmaceuticals makers Egis and Richter.
TVK set a new high of 4,195 forints early in the session and at 0957 GMT traded at 4,165, while Richter surged to a peak of 18,995 forints before retreating slightly.
"International market sentiment bases the rise in Budapest with all bourses trading firmer," Forgo said. "Hungarian shares seem to remain attractive even at current levels."
